pr_title: Modify storage of Layers view queries and preferences

timeline.message: Add layerQueries and Preferences into attribute objects

timeline.author: antares1470
antares1470
antares1470

timeline.bodyText: Is there an alternative to passing the active graph here? Just wondering about the case of executing this all standalone (e.g. in a unit test). For context, executeLater(null) throws an exception
timeline.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText:
I think I get where you are coming from - in the case where there is no active graph, or the graph is closed?
I'm not too aware of other ways - I've seen this way as a standard throughout the project - I could be using it in the wrong context though. @arcturus2 Would a null check here or within the plugin to be executed be necessary?
replies.author: aldebaran30701

replies.bodyText:
I've seen this way as a standard throughout the project - I could be using it in the wrong context though.

I agree @aldebaran30701 it used throughout the code base and context does matter. In general a view should be fine to make the getActiveGraph() call though checking for null here would be required.
I've opted to not do a null check in executeLater deliberately because situations like this can go unnoticed.
replies.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText:
In an attempt to not let situations like this go unnoticed should we add a warning log or something if the current active graph is null?
If the current active graph is null, nothing further should be done correct?
replies.author: aldebaran30701

replies.bodyText:
Yeah @aldebaran30701 I think logging it is a great idea.
So on the topic of things silently passing/failing I commented #602 (comment) that it turns out the plugin is not run in the unit test; a good example of how things get missed. Doing the null check before running executeLater to my mind makes it more obvious when the plugin runs.
replies.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText:
If the current active graph is null, nothing further should be done correct?

Correct. In executeNow() it looks like there is a check for null but not in executeLater. One silently fails and the other throws an exception!
Perhaps a null check and logging it would be fine. This would be a change in the DefaultPluginEnvironment etc and a separate PR I guess. Want me to do it or are you ok to @aldebaran30701 ?
replies.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: Just to reiterate - This code block does not change, but a separate Pr which has a null check and error logging within DefaultPluginEnvironment  is required correct?
replies.author: aldebaran30701

replies.bodyText: Yeah @aldebaran30701 and this is largely to keep your PR focused on the layers code and also because the plugin framework not dealing with nulls (on purpose) is a different problem.
replies.author: arcturus2

timeline.author: antares1470

timeline.bodyText:
@aldebaran30701 this is similar to the problem I am presently looking at. In a unit test getActiveGraph() will be null so you will find that this plugin isn't executed. In the edit() if you print something out I think you will find that it isn't appearing.
The fix would be to pass in graph.
timeline.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: @aldebaran30701 I updated it to use graph and it passed - so executing graph.setIntValue(maxTransactionsId, 0, 9); had no net effect. Do you think a revisit of the unit test or layers code is required?
replies.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText: That would explain why the graph out of sync issue was not reproducible through the unit tests. I assumed it was a product of running it on a single thread.
replies.author: aldebaran30701

replies.bodyText:
So I have also had a play around with this, and it seems that because getActiveGraph() returns null, and graph is the same instance of StoreGraph, I cannot get it to switch.
Ideally within the unit test I would like to be able to mimic the switching of StoreGraphs within the DualGraph instance. I Initialised a DualGraph instance in an attempt to get switching to occur in test cases but still could not replicate the bug even while testing it on the current master which happens to have the bug still active in that branch.
If you have any ideas on this I'm all ears - If i cannot get it to replicate in a unit test should we remove the unit test as it is redundant? @arcturus2
replies.author: aldebaran30701

replies.bodyText: @aldebaran30701 i really like the idea of writing a unit test when fixing bugs as it helps detect it should it come back. I think you are mostly there with it and I'd like to help out to see if I can give some guidance to get the graph switching part to work. I'll get back to you.
replies.author: arcturus2

replies.bodyText:
I've branched off master and added the unit test back in as to replicate the bug and work out how to get the graphs switching in the unit test. https://github.com/constellation-app/constellation/tree/layersSyncTest
I've tried accessing the instances from within the LockingStoreGraph but ran into many issues with private variables
I have just tried to get two writable graphs - both grabbed instance 1. Which is not what is needed.
replies.author: aldebaran30701

replies.bodyText:
I'd like to help out to see if I can give some guidance to get the graph switching part to work

@arcturus2 I think I'll take you up on that offer - Above is the branch I've been testing with.
replies.author: aldebaran30701

replies.bodyText: @aldebaran30701 please see PR #625 and let me know if this helps or not.
replies.author: arcturus2

timeline.message: :white_check_mark: Convert the test to use a DualGraph (#625)

Merge layer update into single plugin

* combines updategraphqueriesplugin with updategraphbitmaskplugin into updatelayerselectionplugin in an attempt to reduce any possible concurrency based bugs
